div.p: [...] for ours could not return due to the force of the storm [...] The French lord has called a meeting at his expense. He is allowed to present his proposal to the communities. The assembly is set for January of the coming year, if I am not mistaken, on the 7th of January, etc.

The Spanish embassy has not initiated anything before the council, nor made any oral proposal, but instead invited the envoys as guests and handed each of them a document, with a request to bring it home for their communities. Therefore, a council was held the next day, and the Spanish lord was refused to proceed this time; since the French lord is in negotiation, it might cause the parties to come together and unrest to arise; however, they want to otherwise orally inform each of their lords at home of their desires, etc. In summary of the document presented: he extols his king to the stars regarding power and majesty; he seeks firm and serious friendship with the Rhaetians. The consul wanted to give a document, sent for it; but Mr. Tscharner had not yet copied it.

However, he does not currently request an assembly; he does this solely to greet the communities and report the favorable will of his king; in the meantime, he wants to negotiate further, etc. - It proceeds so shamelessly that it is a disgrace above all disgrace.

The rumor has spread across the land among the peasantry that the lords, who are lying in Chur, are giving out to each the nearest. There is a great influx; behaving in such a shameless manner that the authorities have enough to defend against, who should rightly be ashamed of such shameless behavior before foreign lords. You have the summary.
I doubt what the outcome will be; I promise myself nothing good. The plans of that other Frenchman disturb them greatly." Chur, 3rd of December, year 1564.

My lords of the Three Leagues have warned the Spanish lords about the expenses, so that later, if they do not receive a favorable response, they would not have to complain and might say that they were deprived of what was theirs and nothing was done for it, etc.
